info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 26 at 12:23PM MST until September 26 at 1:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
SVRPSR
The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a
* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona...
* Until 115 PM MST.
* At 1223 PM MST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Camelback Mountain to near Downtown Mesa, moving northeast at 30 mph.
HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees.
* Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Fountain Hills, Paradise Valley, Sugarloaf Mountain, East Mesa, Cave Creek, Carefree, Tempe Marketplace, Papago Park, Piestewa Peak Park, and Granite Reef Dam.
This includes the following highways... AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 15. US Highway 60 between mile markers 177 and 189. AZ Route 87 between mile markers 171 and 205.
info.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature's leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
